intro: Weinmannia antioquensis, commonly known as the Antioquian weinmannia, is a flowering plant native to the cloud forests of Colombia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its large, showy capitula composed of numerous small florets. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 10 meters. Its leaves are often alternate,革质 (leathery), and have a distinctive, serrated margin. Weinmannia antioquensis is valued for its ornamental qualities and is also of interest for its ecological role in its native habitat.
